content: Yes, Richard Nixon acknowledged that his portrayal of Abraham Lincoln in a school play was particularly influential in his political career. In his book "Leaders," he wrote, "In learning to play Lincoln, I had unconsciously learned a great deal about leadership. I had gained an appreciation of the immense practical difficulties that had to be overcome, an awareness of the need for a hard-headed appraisal of power relations, and a sense of the necessity of utilizing the instincts and prejudices of the people rather than fighting against them."
